answerText: Jordan-Holder theorem[10] The composition series of a group consists of a nested series of this type of subgroup. When given a subgroup of this type, H, and a member of the group, g, it must be true that g times H is equal to H times g.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 5 | 8 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Applying this result to a cyclic group is one method of proving the fundamental theorem of algebra, and this result can be proven using the Schreier refinement theorem. [10] Name this theorem which states that any two composition series of a group are equivalent.
